channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Fed holds interest rates steady, taking a pause from rate cuts to assess the economy
item.description: The central bank cut rates at its three previous meetings in an effort to support the job market. But with inflation still elevated, the Fed is cautio...

item.title: Michael Mayo's 'Fly' is a soaring testament to his artistry and creative vision
item.description: Vocalist Michael Mayo reached new heights through his latest album Fly , with the project earning the crooner his first Grammy nominations of his care...

item.title: Inside the Trump administration's effort to reverse climate change policies
item.description: President Trump calls global warming "a hoax." As the U.S. faces more severe storms and extreme weather events, the New York Times ' David Gelles desc...

item.title: Trump's National Guard deployments could cost over $1 billion this year, CBO projects
item.description: The operation in Washington, D.C. alone is projected to cost upwards of $660 million if it runs through the end of this year as expected, according to...

item.title: The FBI conducts a search at the Fulton County election office in Georgia
item.description: The FBI would not clarify whether the action is tied to the 2020 election, but last month the Department of Justice announced it's suing Fulton County...

item.title: Fed holds interest rates steady in first meeting of 2026
item.description: The Federal Open Market Committee kept the federal funds rate steady, following three rate cuts last year.

item.title: Bessent defends Powell probe:"Independence does not mean no accountability"
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent tells CBS News that Federal Reserve officials must be "beyond reproach" in communicating with the public.

item.title: Deutsche Bank offices raided in money laundering probe
item.description: Officials searched offices in Frankfurt and Berlin in relation to "past business relationships".

item.title: Man arrested in the attack on Ilhan Omar has a criminal history and made pro-Trump posts
'Don't take us to a hospital': Iran protesters treated in secret to avoid arrest
item.description: Wounded demonstrators tell the BBC they are relying on medics willing to risk their own safety by treating them at their homes.

item.title: Iran's internet is returning - but not for everyone
item.description: The country cut off internet access on 8 January following a government crackdown on protesters.

item.title: Would-be assassin of Iranian dissident sentenced to 15 years in prison

item.title: Trump warns Iran 'time is running out' for nuclear deal as US military builds up in Gulf
item.description: Tehran says its armed forces are ready "with their fingers on the trigger" to respond to any aggression.

item.title: Trump signals interest in easing tensions, but Minneapolis sees little change on the streets
item.description: President Donald Trump seemed to signal a willingness to ease tensions in Minneapolis after a second deadly shooting by federal immigration agents.

item.title: Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase to contribute $1,000 to Trump Accounts

item.title: FBI executing search order at Fulton County elections hub
item.description: FBI agents are executing a search at a warehouse that serves as Fulton County's election hub.
